defense: Written Arguments Submitted on Behalf of Assessee

complaint_summary: The case involves a dispute over the valuation of land at the rate of Rs. 2.80 per square yard as confirmed by the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal.
investigation_summary: The Income-tax Appellate Tribunal confirmed the Deputy Commissioner (Appeals)'s order regarding the valuation of land. The appellant sought clarification on whether this decision was legally correct.
judgment_summary: The court directed the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal to state the case and refer the question of law regarding the valuation of land for judicial opinion. No order as to costs was issued.
legal_arguments: Whether the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal was legally correct in confirming the order of the Deputy Commissioner (Appeals) on the point of value of land at Rs. 2.80 per square yard.
key_issues: Valuation of land at Rs. 2.80 per square yard
Legal correctness of Income-tax Appellate Tribunal's decision

legal_terms.Income-tax Appellate Tribunal: A quasi-judicial body that adjudicates disputes related to income tax.

words_and_phrases.Order Accordingly: A directive issued by the court indicating the conclusion of the case.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around the valuation of land at Rs. 2.80 per square yard and the legal correctness of the Income-tax Appellate Tribunal's decision. The court directed the Tribunal to refer the question for judicial opinion without issuing any order as to costs.
